Module kivakit.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.context

Class CallStack

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.core.messaging.context.CallStack
public class CallStack extends Object
A stack of KivaKit Method objects for a given thread (callstack(Thread) or the current thread callstack().

The caller of a given class on the stack (the "callee") can be determined with callerOf(Proximity, Matching, Class, Matching, Class[]), which takes the callee type and a variable number of classes to ignore. Matching of the caller and its distance from the callee are specified by the first and second parameters respectively.

For example, the class A might want to determine who called it (for a concrete example see Debug, which finds its caller in order to switch on/off debugging for that class). This makes class A the callee. It might also wish to ignore another class in the same package, class B, which might be on the stack between the caller and the callee. In this case, CallStack.callerOf(..., A.class, B.class) would return the code which is calling method(s) in A whether it called through method(s) in B or not.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

    • callerOf

      public static Method callerOf(CallStack.Proximity proximity, CallStack.Matching matching, Class<?> calleeType)

    • callerOf

      public static Method callerOf(CallStack.Proximity proximity, CallStack.Matching matching, Class<?> calleeType, CallStack.Matching ignoreMatching, Class<?>... ignores)
      Finds the (KivaKit) Method that called the given callee class. The CallStack.Matching parameter is used to specify whether classes should exactly match the given class parameters or if subclasses are acceptable as well. Because intervening frames may be uninteresting, the CallStack.Proximity type can be used to determine if the caller must be the immediate caller or if a more distant caller is acceptable. It is possible to specify a variable-length list of classes to ignore when determining the calling method after finding the callee. This makes it easy to skip over intervening frames that don't matter.
      Parameters:
      proximity - Either CallStack.Proximity.IMMEDIATE if the caller must be immediately before the callee on the stack or CallStack.Proximity.DISTANT if the caller can be anywhere on the stack
      matching - Either CallStack.Matching.EXACT or CallStack.Matching.SUBCLASS to determine if matching of the type parameters should be exact or if any subclass will do
      calleeType - The class that we want the caller of
      ignoreMatching - Matching for the classes to be ignored
      ignores - Any intermediate classes to ignore
      Returns:
      The class that most recently called the given callee on this thread's execution stack

    • callstack

      public static List<Method> callstack()

    • callstack

      public static List<Method> callstack(Thread thread)
